description: Dinner and Brunch Cruises Toronto is offering you the opportunity to experience Toronto's vibrant harbourfront and stunning views of Toronto's beautiful skyline. If you're looking for delicious food, fabulous entertainment and stunning views a lunch, Sunday Brunch Cruise or Dinner Cruise aboard Obsession III is the perfect cruise for you.

reviews.title: Cruising lake Ontario
text: Great view great staff
Food was plenty and very good.
Drinks was flowing
would do it again only this time I would do the dinner cruise and dance.

reviews.title: Unfortunately, a complete waste of money and time
text: We went on the Obsession III sunset dinner cruise this past Saturday. It was a special birthday for my daughter so I purchased tickets and took her friends with us. They were all very excited, talked about it for weeks, got dressed up. They have never done anything like this. Turns out it was a huge disappointment and huge waste of money. Not at all worth what you will pay ($10 fee is added on to each ticket price, as well as tax). I have never left a negative review for anything, but this time I felt it was important to let people know not to waste their money. When I purchased the tickets, I requested to be seated at the window. This did not happen until I asked to be moved to the window. Then the dinner. I am not a foodie, neither is my daughter and friends. But honestly, it was the worst meal we have ever had. And it took three hours to finally get the main course! Like almost inedible food. There are no proper facilities on board to cook and plate the food so maybe this is why. We could see the food being plated from where we sat and I would be shocked if that area could pass a food safety inspection. When dessert was served, it was supposed to come with sparklers for the birthday but this did not happen. DJ and dancing is advertised, which was the biggest draw for us. But by the time the food was finally all served, there was only time to dance to one song. The music was shut down and we were back in the harbour by 10:00 pm, yet the Saturday cruises are supposed to go until 10:30 pm. The one and only good thing I will say is that the staff work incredibly hard. They are on their feet non-stop the entire cruise, serving food and drinks. They deserve to be paid well. Thank you for reading this. I could never recommend this cruise. If there were refunds allowed, I would absolutely ask for one.

reviews.title: Excellent Experience
text: I highly recommend for a night out, make sure you get up and dance too, dancing on a boat is an experience in itself!
The views are spectacular, the vibe was great, music was groovy, staff were great, dinner was grand; It was a lot of Fun!

reviews.title: Very unpleasant and couldn't wait to get off the boat
text: Terrible ...not at all advertised...the dinner was ok ..not great...the music was atrocious....so loud and not at all relaxing...complained but fell on deaf ears...obviously they didn't hear me...dining area was lawn chairs and folding tables...not impressed...would not recommend or ever go again

reviews.title: Day with sisters
text: Two of my sisters and I and husbands did this cruise for a nice afternoon.  The boat was nice and we had a very good time.  The brunch was ok but it was not very hot at all.  We did enjoy it and the desserts were good.

reviews.title: Overall
text: The staff and crew were very friendly and the views and overall atmosphere was very enjoyable.   The buffet wasn't attended to properly (food was not replenished so by the time the last table got theirs some bowls like salad or veggie bowl was empty and not refilled).  The experience was great but they need to improve on the food (temp, variety, enough of it for all).

reviews.title: Guests
text: The staff was great,very friendly. The DJ was kinda mean unable to choose a song.My chicken stuffing was spoil and cold,had to send it back.

reviews.title: Great experience!
text: We had a great time! The food was fresh, hot and tasty and the vegetarian dish was a delight. The service couldn't have been better:  our server "Champ" truly was a champ!!  When we first looked this cruise up we saw some negative reviews online which were a bit off putting (don't know why anyone would have anything negative to say...perhaps they are confusing with another cruise boat?!) but we were so glad we went and we would go again!

reviews.title: Very Nice
text: Friendly staff and the food was delicious! A great value. I would recommend this cruise and would suggest you take the Go train into the city!

reviews.title: Expected More.
text: Staff was very friendly, onboarding was quick & smooth. Possibly understaffed & mismanaged? Was a little difficult to get refills on drinks and dessert service was very long and one guest made a substitution request/inquiry but no one got back to them. One guest didn't receive a salad and another didn't receive dessert. Menu selection looked good, however prep was lacking. Chicken was a little dry, green/string beans were basic. Beef & sauce were "just ok" per guests, no one had the pasta, can't comment on it. Mixed drinks were fairly priced, however 2 guests didn't like how they were prepared and let them sit. Jackson Triggs for wine. View/skyline was very nice at sunset. Despite the above, no one complained, which is what made the evening most enjoyable, the company. Had expected a better dining experience for the price.

reviews.title: Dinner cruise Obsession III Aug 2021
text: Overall my experience on the Obsession III was very positive. The host/manager Brian was very friendly and welcoming.

Our waiter, Anthony, was so personable and attentive! He was also working with one arm as his other arm was in a sling! He always had a smile and did a great job checking in on our table to ensure we had everything we needed.

The bathrooms were very clean however there were a lot of spider webs throughout the boat and it could use a little TLC, but honestly wasn‚Äôt that big of a deal to me. It was great to be able to walk around the boat and take a lot of different photos.

If I was really going to be picky it would be about the food portions. All the food had great flavour/seasoning but portions were very small. My boyfriend had steak but honestly the salt shaker on the table was bigger and same with my chicken it was quite a small portion. Definitely not a quarter chicken. But again flavour was good. We were served appetizers, salad, main course, and dessert.

I would say alcohol prices fair in comparison to most restaurants. We purchased a pitcher of Sangria for $42. It was delicious and we easily  got 10 wine glasses out of it!!!!! So I was impressed with that.
The music was great. A good mix for everyone. During the actual dinner they played instrumental jazz which was nice.
We had perfect weather for our cruise which made the experience that much more enjoyable.
I would definitely recommend this experience to others and I would do it again myself!
Thanks to all the staff upfront and behind the scenes! You made for a great experience!!!! üëçüèª

reviews.title: Very poor experience
text: Terrible experience the food was below average, the boat was dirty with spiders, the kitchen area looked awful. The food was stale, I would not do this again ever.

reviews.title: High Seas
text: Food was good, views were spectacular, boarding was professionally handled. The islands give a different viewpoint of Toronto. Very positive thing to do.

reviews.title: Nice trip
text: The perfect way to spend Valentine‚Äôs Day! Let‚Äôs hope we‚Äôll be able to do it again soon. We have great memories of that day!

reviews.title: Excellent
text: it was a very good experince my kids like it aprox 2 hour trip with delicius food.around the downtown airport

reviews.title: Wonderful morning
text: We went on the brunch cruise and had a really great morning. Good buffet, good drinks, beautiful view - what more could you ask for?

reviews.title: Cruise ended much earlier than advertised.
text: Cruise ended much earlier than advertised. Wrong dinner was provided. I was promised a free drink as compensation, but that was not provided.

reviews.title: Great for Toronto skyline views
text: We took the evening sunset cruise version on the Obsession III  which included dinner. You can purchase wine (bottles) in advance when you book your tickets, but there is no advantage to doing this. The wine on the menu is readily available and the price is the same. The booking will tell you to get there 30 minutes in advance, and you should arrive at least that early. There was a big line up when we arrived, and the on-boarding moved slowly-they take a photo of each couple or party as the board to try and sell it to you later. There is upper and lower floor seating and it is first come first served-you can‚Äôt reserve. Don‚Äôt be disappointed by about not getting the seat you thought you wanted. You can easily walk out to a viewing deck while you are waiting for dinner, and once you are finished, you can go out on deck again and admire the view all you want. In fact, my preference turned out to be the bottom floor where I was seated, because they leave that floor alone, but the top floor, they clear after dinner, and move the tables to the sides for guests to enjoy the music and dancing available if they want. The dinner was fine, nothing worth raving about. The views are amazing-the Toronto
Island, the evolving city skyline as sun sets ,the planes landing and taking off, the water traffic..this boat cruise makes viewing all that very enjoyable.

reviews.title: Nice views of the city...but that's about it.
text: While the cruise itself was fun, the food was so-so. My wife was supposed to get steak, but got fatty prime rib instead. Drinks are pricey and the DJ started late and didn't really play traditional Top 40 like was advertised.

reviews.title: Excellet way to spnd the night!
text: We were very lucky to have a dinner cruise on board of Obsession III for my daughter's birthday.

The service was excellent, the crew very attentive and creative. The food was very good. We also liked the way the boat goes along the islands, but then leaves to the open lake. The city views were stunning, and we were extremely lucky with the weather that night.
We all had fun, dancing on the boat after the dinner.

reviews.title: Disgusting Food.
text: The boat is really dated. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The so called ‚Äúbrunch‚Äù was barely even a breakfast. It was disgusting. They ration you as well. The French toast was hard and dry, you get those McCain $1 hash browns (they only give you a tablespoon full) 2 sausage that are white looking, 2 extremely hard pieces of bacon, a tiny little piece of what they call egg and the dessert was those discount mini muffins and small cinnamon buns which were stale. The vegetables were a can of corn with a few baby carrots thrown in. So bad. We ate first and it was cold so the people upstairs on the boat definitely got really cold food. The route the boat takes was nice. Nice view of Toronto. We had to go eat somewhere after the trip. No ice. We ordered a 5 bucket of beer which did not come in a bucket. The beers went warm. I do not recommend this brunch to anyone. Not good.

reviews.title: The food wasn't good
text: The food was horrible. The cheese was sweating when we got it and the steaks omg I wouldn't have given them to a dog. Prob wouldn't have been able to chew it anyway. Asked for the steaks to have no blood not over well done. All the veggies had a funny taste. The boat ride itself was ok.

reviews.title: Not so great.
text: The food was terrible, which pretty much made the whole experience sad. We could've rented a yacht and gone around the lake without going on the cruise! And due to covid we had to reschedule keeping in mind everyone's safety, even then we were charged twice! I changed it to 1 star instead of 2, mainly because of they'd rather take your money than ensure safety for everyone.

reviews.title: Birthday Celebration
text: Very relaxing and scenic dinner cruise.  We left on time and everything went smoothly.  The staff were very pleasant.  Seating was arranged nicely and well planned to accomodate large groups and tables for two for a more intimate experience.  The meal was tasty and the appetiziers a nice added touch.  I woud have liked my food hotter (heat) so maybe tweaking how that is managed would be great.  The boat itself could use a good interior paint job, however it was decorated and lit up with fancy lights as night approached and music waned.  The DJ was awesome!!!!  with tunes for every age and era. Guests from all walks of life shared that sentiment as the dance floor was never empty.
Thanks for a memorable cruise.  Would highly recommend....

reviews.title: Don't go on brunch cruise
text: We paid 160CAD for 2 people brunch cruise. Coffee and water were free, other drinks we had to pay. Each person got their own plate served by staff as follows:
First plate they served us had one strawberry, 2 grapes, one piece of cantaloupe, one piece of watermelon.
Second plate had mini pastries, 4 in total per person. The kind that you get in giant bags at the grocery store. They were stale and dry.
Third plate had scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, one breakfast sausage, 2 pieces of bacon and two slices of toast.
That's it.
I would never do this We paid 160CAD for 2 people brunch cruise. Coffee and water were free, other drinks we had to pay. Each person got their own plate served by staff as follows:
First plate they served us had one strawberry, 2 grapes, one piece of cantaloupe, one piece of watermelon.
Second plate had mini pastries, 4 in total per person. The kind that you get in giant bags at the grocery store. They were stale and dry.
Third plate had scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, one breakfast sausage, 2 pieces of bacon and two slices of toast.
That's it. I would never do this cruise again and I would not recommend it to anyone.
The boat is also not that nice. There are a lot of boats in Toronto that are way nicer and you don't have to pay 80 dollars per person

reviews.title: Social distancing not enforced
text: Mask mandate also not enforced.  In fact the passengers were encouraged to mix and mingle on the dance floor and non were masked. Formal complaint was registered afterwards and unsatistisfactory response received.   Will NOT book with them again

reviews.title: Birthday dinner with my boyfriend
text: Overall horrible experience. The boat was dirty and had cobweb all over it. Dinner was horrible. What they called garden salad was a few green leaves with a small tomato on top. Food portion was small. Service was poor. Desert was choice of vanilla or chocolate cake but when they arrived at my table there was only chocolate cake left and I do not eat chocolate. No variety to choose from. Very limited dishes. Just Overall a bad experience.  Would definitely not return or recommend it.

reviews.title: Didn't wind up going!
text: We didn't wind up going on the cruise. My wife was not feeling well and I had to stay home to take care of her. And it was too late to cancel the trip.

reviews.title: SPIDERS
text: My experience on this trip was horrible, it went way down on my expectations contrary to the reviews and recommendations you have and I got to reserve this.

The boat was not clean at all, and it was infested with spiders, I have a phobia to spiders unfortunately and this made me very uncomfortable, panicking every time I saw something and in many occasions the kids were jumping out of their seats since the spiders were going down the wall. I also received a carrot cake muffin that had mold in it. I got the attention of the waiter on the situation and she told me that many people have said the same thing and nothing has done anything about it. I do not think this is worth my money at all being this $385 unpleasant boat ride experience.

reviews.title: Awesome evening!
text: It was such a great experience. Food is simple but delicious. The staff is courteous and professional. The manger Brian is super nice a and personable. And the DJ does an amazing job with reading the guests and playing super music.
Thank you everyone for a great evening!

reviews.title: Great Canada Day Weekend Cruise
text: I went on this cruise a few years ago before COVID and I am happy to say that it is even better than I remembered! They have made some additions to the menu, in particular being much more accommodating for vegan diets, which my mom needed.

I really liked the slower pace of the cruise around the Toronto harbour, and the seating was comfortable. The music choices were also really good! They played a lot of bangers. It would be a really nice experience to show someone from out of town.

reviews.title: Did our mini honeymoon at Toronto Obsession
text: The views are amazing especially for great pictures, the staff were super friendly but the food wasn't worth it for the price! Would still recommend it for the experience!

reviews.title: too loud music
text: Music was too loud to enjoy trip. Also we could smell smoke coming from engine (machinery department)

reviews.title: Disappointing experience
text: The food provided was awful‚Ä¶similar to airplane quality food. I understand that the food can‚Äôt be prepared on the boat, but the ticket price was overly inflated for the quality of the experience.

reviews.title: Beautiful cruise
text: A bit more effort could be made on the menu and freshness of the ingredients, overall good experience. The cruise was beautiful.

reviews.title: Exceptional Toronto Island Cruise
text: Brought the whole family for a Mother's Day brunch cruise and the experience was well worth it. We got to see beautiful scenery throughout the Islands. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. My kids, aged 8&9, also enjoyed the experience. Honestly, easily a 5/5 experience. Would absolutely recommend while in Toronto.

reviews.title: Mostafa/ Hamilton Ontario
text: Food was terrible and not enough for every one test terrible when asked the waitress about muffin which there were little amount of it he said it was served at a wedding the day before and no more left. Orange juice was watery 3/4 of it water and ice. Service is very slaw, asked for coffee it took for them forever to prepare it and it taste horrible. Never go back again.

reviews.title: Disappointed
text: Loud annoying. Wait staff horrible. They're wearing street clothes and don't even know what is being served. The food is actually quite pathetic for an over 100$ meal. Seriously hamburger buns for bread. Sorry I can't continue, I didn't think Pirates still existed.

reviews.title: Do not recommend, money grab for poor experience.
text: I do not recommend the Obsession III boat experience, I wished I‚Äôd seen some of the reviews on here before booking.
My experience consisted of:
- Not many options of food (didn‚Äôt cook enough for the size of audience)
- Vegetarian food on the buffet had run out
- Sitting on Garden plastic chairs back-to-back with the next table with no space
- Rude staff
Better yet, we were celebrating my Mom birthday and I‚Äôve emailed my feedback several times and no response from the company; they don‚Äôt care! Go elsewhere!!
The boat also looks in awful condition and need a paint job and clean, check the other boats out in the area.

reviews.title: Disappointing and Not worth your Money
text: The crew wasnt very organized. No announcement was made about when the buffet was being served. When we finally got in line, most of the food ran out including pastries and fruit. The server just threw the food on our plates and they all looked as though they didn't want to be there. The coffee and tea were not included and we were charged $2.50 per coffee. Rather disappointing as the meal was mediocre for what we paid. Only redeeming quality about this afternoon were the great views we saw of the Toronto skyline. Highly recommend you save your money and use it for a cruise - only trip around the harbour on one of the other company cruise ships for $25 and enjoy just the views and go to an AYCE buffet somewhere else in the city.
